entry.title: Oppt Prioritization score custom Agent in SAP CX AI Toolkit
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am trying to create a custom AI agent for opportunities called Oppt Prioritization score agent. For this i created an AI Tool by giving the following prompt:

You are an opportunity prioritization agent in the SAP CX AI Toolkit for SAP Sales Cloud V2. Analyze all opportunities with Opprtunity.Status with Open status.

Calculate the prioritization score based on the following weighted criteria:
1. Opportunity.Expected_Value (50% weight)
2. Opportunity.Probability (30% weight)
3. Opportunity.Close_Date within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date (20% weight)
Assumptions
4.Opportunity.Probability is assumed to be a percentage (0-100).
5.The Opportunity.Close_Date condition is binary, based on whether it falls within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date, interpreted as future dates for prioritization.

Priotitization Score = 0.5*{Opportunity.Expected_Value} + 0.3*{Opportunity.Probability} + 0.2*{cases}
1 {ifOpportunity.Close_Date is within 30 days from the Opportunity.Current_Date} else
0
end{cases}

Provide a one-sentence explanation per opportunity justifying its ranking and, sorted by Amount (descending). Use a professional tone and avoid technical jargon.
For each opportunity, provide a brief, actionable follow-up recommendation (e.g., “Schedule a discovery call to discuss budget constraints”). Use a concise, professional tone and leverage intelligent Q&A to ensure recommendations are contextually relevant.
Include a summary of recent interactions for each opportunity, generated using the toolkit’s AI summary capabilities. Use a professional tone and ensure recommendations support team collaboration.
Ensure Output Fits Within 5000 Chatacters
Compact Formatting--> Remove unnecessary spaces & line breaks.
Limit Answer Length--> Max 500 Characters per answer, truncate with "..."

I assigned this AI tool to the custom AI Agent.The details (PFA screenshot) which are used are

Expected value = 15000 USD

Probability = 80

Close Date = 25 Jul 2025

The calculation for close date is incorrect, it should be 1, but it is coming as 0. Any suggestions how can i achieve the condition for the close date?

entry.title: AI Won’t Save Bad Data: Lessons from the Field in Supplier Management
entry.content:
Let’s be honest: supplier management isn’t always glamorous.

You know that moment when a supplier insists they’ve already registered — and you realize they used the wrong ANID (again)? Or when you're prepping for a risk review and notice half your supplier questionnaires are incomplete?

In my role in SAP Solution Value Advisory, I work with customers across industries to help them get the most out of SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle & Performance (SLP) and Supplier Risk. Every company is different, but the challenges tend to be the same — especially as AI becomes a bigger part of the conversation.

One thing I say to customers (half-joking, half-pleading) is this: AI won’t save bad data. It’ll just make your bad data faster.

If you're aiming for AI-driven insights and automation, the groundwork matters more than ever. That means:

  • Structuring your supplier registration flows thoughtfully, and using Modular Questionnaires where applicable
  • Regularly cleaning up duplicate or inactive supplier records
  • Making it easy — and worthwhile — for suppliers to participate

Set Your Suppliers Up for Success

I’ve seen too many teams stuck chasing suppliers to complete registrations, risk assessments, and questionnaires. Features like automated reminders and nudges can help, but participation truly improves when:

  • Suppliers understand what’s in it for them
  • The process is simple and straightforward
  • You provide clear guidance (even a short how-to video can work wonders)

We can’t control supplier behavior — but we can control the experience we create.


Not Sure Where to Start?

Here are a few lesser-used gems in Ariba SLP that can make a big difference in onboarding and maintaining clean supplier data:

  • Process Framework – Collect supplier info that’s commodity/region-specific, or doesn’t belong in the initial registration
  • Preferred Supplier Flags – Especially useful if you're using Guided Buying
  • Approval Workflows by Category or Region – More control without more noise
  • Supplier Data Snapshots & Reporting – Track onboarding durations, identify bottlenecks, and analyze where your process might be over-engineered.

Maybe you’re collecting data too early. Maybe some supplier types are being asked for more than they need to provide. Don’t be afraid to question whether your current setup still fits your organization’s broader Source-to-Pay process.

Data Today = AI Tomorrow

Customers often ask me:
“Will Ariba use AI to flag risky suppliers?”
“Can it automate profile scoring?”

Yes — exciting things are on the way. But AI depends on patterns. And patterns only emerge from clean, complete, consistent data. Think of it like training a chef with a messy fridge. If half your ingredients are mislabeled, expired, or missing, you’re not getting a Michelin-star meal, you’re getting mystery soup.

What I’d love to hear from you:
What’s your biggest supplier management headache? What clever workaround have you built in Ariba? How do you motivate suppliers to fill out their info?

Drop a comment or message me here in the SAP Community, I’d love to connect!

entry.title: SAP Analytic Cloud has really limited functionalities. Am I using it correctly?
entry.content:
Hey gurus,
supposedly this is SAP's product to compete against tableau or power bi

  • Linked dimension has to be in the graph or widget not working, so it's extremely limited compared to power pivot which can be sliced however you want as long as there's a linked dimension.

For example if i have a table with sales and customer ID and another table with customer ID and customer region. Power pivot can easily do a graph of sales by customer region as long as customer ID fields are linked. Whereas in SAC, the linked dimension which is the customer ID has to stay in the graph or it renders error. but what's the point of linked dimension havng to be in the graph to make it work? the whole point of linking to me is establishing relationship so that I can explor the data in differe ways.

  • No good way to do calculations easily, eg if sales is a measure, it doesn’t seem possible to do counts/sum/avg at the same time or to do filtering by criteria(sales > 100$). If it’s dimension, sum is not possible. The dimension to measure function can only do count/avg.
  • Data models not working in stories only working if I go to data analyzer and do ad hoc.

entry.title: Re: Need to modify Reference Number (VBRK-XBLNR) in Billing document VF01
entry.content: changing the XBLNR (Reference Document Number) field in the VBRK (Billing Document Header) table in SAP can be considered a malpractice and might be penalized during an audit. The XBLNR field is intended to store the customer's purchase order number or a relevant reference for the billing document. Altering this field after the document is created can obscure the original reference, leading to discrepancies and potentially masking errors or fraudulent activities.

entry.title: Re: Where are exchange rates actually used in business pr...
entry.content:
Hi @Simon_Lehnert ,

Here is small synopsis of usage.

ModuleProcessExchange Rate UsageExampleKey T-Codes
FI (Financial Accounting)Foreign currency journal entriesConverts foreign currency to company code currencyUSD invoice posted in EUR company codeFB50, FB60, F-53
 Incoming/Outgoing paymentsRevaluation at clearing, gain/loss calculatedPayment after FX rate changesF-28, F-53
 Month-end valuationUnrealized FX valuationF.05 calculates FX gain/loss on open itemsF.05
 Asset transactionsConverts acquisition cost in foreign currencyAsset purchased in USD in EUR ledgerABZON, AB01
MM (Materials Management)Purchase Order (PO)Converts PO value from vendor currencyPO in USD for EUR companyME21N
 Goods Receipt (GR)Uses exchange rate to calculate GR/IR in local currencyUSD PO posted at current EUR rateMIGO
 Invoice Receipt (IR)Converts invoice amount to company currencyExchange difference between GR and IRMIRO
SD (Sales and Distribution)Sales OrderPricing in foreign currency converted to localSO created in USD for EUR companyVA01
 Billing DocumentRevenue in both foreign and company currencyUSD billing posted to EUR ledgerVF01, VF03
 Revenue RecognitionApplies historical rate for accrual/revenue matchingEnsures consistency over timeVF44, FARR_RAI_MON
CO (Controlling)Internal postings across currenciesConverts cost postings to controlling area currencyActivity allocation USD → EURKB21N, KSB1
 Plan vs ActualCurrency fluctuation affects cost comparisonFX impact on budgeted costsKP06, KSB1
TRM (Treasury & Risk)FX contracts, hedgingUses daily exchange rates for valuationUSD/EUR FX forward contractTPM60, TBB1
 Position valuationDaily mark-to-market revaluationPortfolio revalued with M rateTPM1, TBB4
PS (Project System)WBS cost planningConverts project costs from transaction to controlling currencyProject in USD, controlling in EURCJ20N, CJ40
TM (Travel Management)Expense reimbursementReimburses employee in local currencyTrip in USD, paid in EURPR05, FI-TV
Group Reporting / ConsolidationFinancial consolidationConverts local currency to group currencyConsolidation at HQ level (e.g., EUR)CX00, ACDOCU reports
Intercompany BillingCross-currency reconciliationApplies exchange rate during intercompany invoiceUSD invoice to EUR sister companyVF01, FB60

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Cloud ALM and SAP BPA Integration
entry.content:
Presently, SAP Cloud ALM offers a built-in option to define a Requirements approval workflow that can integrate with SAP Build Process Automation.  There is no option to define a workflow for a Projects > Features, nor other Subscription types (e.g. User Story, Project Task, etc).  

See KBA 3634841.

Blog: SAP Cloud ALM: requirement approval with external ... - SAP Community share information on configuring this for Requirements.

entry.title: SAP ME/MII msg type yieldConfirmationRequest goes into RETRY status and MESYS blocks reservation
entry.content:
Hi Experts ,

 

Did you faced these behaviours:

     SAP ME/MII native message type yieldConfirmationRequest goes always into RETRY status when is processed for the

first time and only when the message is re-processed , the second time , it goes into correct status PASSED ; This is not good

at all because it increasing the processing time of the messages inside the MII queue ;

     The second behavior is that the componentAddRequest message always goes first into FAILED status with the message:

User MESYS blocks the reservation xxxxxxxxxxxx  ; Those kind of failed messages became PASSED only if they are manually RETRY; This is not good also because a time consuming manually intervention is needed  ;

    The above behaviours appeared after we installed: 

                                    SAP ME 15.5 Patch 43 first and then Patch 44 , SAP XMII 15.5.2.1 and  SAP MII_ADMIN 15.5.2.1 ;

    Thank you in advance for your help !

 

Best Regards,

Paul

entry.title: Shared Resource Scenario in PPDS
entry.content:
Hi All,

We have a case where two packing lines share 6 hoppers. The goal is to make sure these hoppers are used properly when scheduling orders in PPDS.

For example:

  1. If Packing Line 1 uses 3 hoppers, then Packing Line 2 can use the remaining 3.
  2. If Packing Line 1 uses 4 hoppers, then only 2 are left for Packing Line 2.

While scheduling, we need to:

  1. Use the hopper capacity efficiently and keep both packing lines running without idle time.
  2. Schedule orders based on priority and with minimal setup time

Mapping the Hoppers in S4 and PPDS - 

Currently, the business defines hopper availability by quantity (number of hoppers), not by time (hours). So, how should we maintain its capacity?

Let us know if you guys have come across a similar scenario in any of your projects, and feel free to share any suggestions or recommendations you might have.

Thanks

Debasis Nanda

entry.title: Automatic Interest Rate Fixing - TJ05
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a question related to TJ05 and would appreciate help on this.

My client has an investment instrument where the interest changes daily. But in reality the change happens once a while. For e.g. if the investment is made on Jan. 1, 2009, the interest changed on Jan 15, Jan 18, Feb 20 ..... But since I chose a variable interest rate which changes daily, I have to fix this rate daily. But since TJ05 will fix only if there is a rate on each date, we have to enter the rate daily even though there is no change.

Is there a way we can overcome this? I mean can we just enter the rate only on those days when it changes but the transaction is fixed daily by TJ05?

Thanks!

this is the xs-security I used for the backend.

python code:

from hdbcli import dbapi
from dotenv import load_dotenv
import os
from crewai import Agent, Task, Crew, LLM, Process
from hanadb_tool import HanaNL2SQLTool
import yaml
from flask import Flask, request, jsonify
from sap.xssec import create_security_context  # Corrected import
import json

load_dotenv()

app = Flask(__name__)
hanadb_tool = HanaNL2SQLTool(db_uri=os.getenv("hana_uri"))
os.environ["OPENAI_API_KEY"] = os.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY")
llm = LLM(model="openai/gpt-4o-mini", temperature=0.3)

with open("./agents.yaml", "r") as file:
    agent_config = yaml.safe_load(file)

with open("./tasks.yaml", "r") as file:
    task_config = yaml.safe_load(file)

class HanaDBCrew:
    def __init__(self):
        self.hanadb_tool = hanadb_tool

    def sql_query_agent(self) -> Agent:
        return Agent(
            config=agent_config['sql_query_agent'],
            tools=[self.hanadb_tool],
            llm=llm,
            verbose=True,
            allow_delegation=False,
            memory=False
        )

    def query_translation_task(self) -> Task:
        return Task(
            config=task_config['query_translation_task'],
            verbose=True,
            agent=self.sql_query_agent(),
            allow_delegation=False,
            memory=False
        )

    def crew(self) -> Crew:
        return Crew(
            agents=[self.sql_query_agent()],
            tasks=[self.query_translation_task()],
            verbose=True,
            memory=False,
            process=Process.sequential,
        )

crew_instance = HanaDBCrew()


@app.route('/', methods=['GET'])
def health_check():
    """A simple endpoint to confirm the service is running."""
    return jsonify({"status": "ok", "message": "Service is up and running!"}), 200



@app.route('/api/query', methods=['POST'])
def run_query():
    try:
        # --- Start of final, corrected security block ---
        auth_header = request.headers.get('Authorization')
        if not auth_header:
            return jsonify({"error": "No authorization header"}), 401

        # This part remains the same
        vcap_services = os.getenv('VCAP_SERVICES')
        if not vcap_services:
            return jsonify({"error": "VCAP_SERVICES not found"})    #, 500
        xsuaa_credentials = json.loads(vcap_services).get('xsuaa', [{}])[0].get('credentials', {})

        token = auth_header.split(" ")[-1]
        security_context = create_security_context(token, xsuaa_credentials)

        # Define ONLY the local part of the scope.
        local_scope = "run_query"

        # Use the correct function. It will automatically find the xsappname
        # and check for "crewai-hana-app!t482354.run_query" in the token.
        if not security_context.check_local_scope(local_scope):
             return jsonify({"error": f"Unauthorized: Missing required local scope: {local_scope}"}), 403
        # --- End of final, corrected security block ---

        # Process request - this part remains the same
        data = request.get_json()
        user_request = data.get('user_request')
        if not user_request:
            return jsonify({"error": "Missing user_request in payload"}), 400

        crew = crew_instance.crew()
        result = crew.kickoff(inputs={'user_request': user_request})
        return jsonify({"result": str(result)}), 200
    except Exception as e:
        return jsonify({"error": str(e)}) #, 500

if __name__ == "__main__":
    port = int(os.environ.get('PORT', 8080))
    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=port)


 this is the backend. I hope this might help you to help me :). Thank you so much for your time

entry.title: Re: Details about Mime Type Assignment for Converted Medi...
entry.content:
I have analyzed your question about the problem with the mime type, which was fixed in version .39. This problem was:

  • Converted image has other mime type than defined in the media format
  • Media format that has the input format set to media created based on the converted media will throw the below exception during conversion 

"convert: improper image header `/tmp/src***' @ error/png.c/ReadPNGImage/3964. convert: no images defined `/tmp/target*** @ error/convert.c/ConvertImageCommand/3354."

The issue is caused by the Azure SDK library upgrade to version 12. The logic that calculates the "mime type" is based on the number of bytes available in the InputStream implementation used during the conversion process. After upgrading to the newer library version, the InputStream started returning a different number of bytes.

The problem has been fixed in version 2211.39

For reference: KBA 3612789 - Mime type mismatch during image conversion

entry.title: Re: Intermittent Error While Opening WWI Report in CG54
entry.content:
Hello

reading between the lines: the problem comes up in a productive environment.

Proposal: by using "ESTDH" for a case there you have this error: you will find the "DMS" key. By using the DMS transactions you can get in touch with the document direct.

Here you can try to use "WordPad" etc. TO check if you can open the document.

Other option would be: generate a new report (assuming that the gen. variant is on level "complete" and not released and check again in CG50)

Further option: if you have more than one detected case: check ESTDH / CG54 if you can find a pattern like: all reports are created on same date; or have same gen.var

You can check as well the "Structure" file of the report (table ESTLS) if you can find something different in comparison to a report which is "ok".

For safety reasons: check any WWI server: Do they have the same WWI set up, same version etc.

Keep in mind: SAP delivers roughly twice a year a new WWI version.

But honestly. never had a similar case

C.B.

PS: if you have one case: for any "local client" the result should be the same (i do not believe that this is a local winword/windows issue; but for safety reasons)

entry.title: Tax Reporting Date is not editable for most countries in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, VAT reporting is based on the Tax Reporting Date (technocal field VATDATE), which determines the period in which a transaction is reported for VAT purposes. For countries like Poland and Slovakia, SAP allows manual editing of the Tax Reporting Date on posted journal entries. 

Is there any possibility to edit this field for other countries – e.g. France or Germany? Sometimes, when a user initially assigns the tax reporting date incorrectly, there is no way to change it except for reversal and posting new document. 

REMARK: We do not have 5XU license.

entry.title: MDK ImageCollection Cache
entry.content:
My online Android app has a page that has an ImageCollection that retrieves media entities from an OData v2 service.  After pushing the photos feature and several weeks of use, my users have got warnings from their device that they are running out of space (Zerbra devices with a low amount of storage).  In testing on my own device, I've noticed that the cache amount does go up whenever I go into the image collection page and it downloads images.  (Note that I also have an attachment control on the same page that does a resize of the image before uploading, but after using that control several times, the cache storage does not go up so I'm quite sure the issue is coming from the ImageCollection control.)

Are there settings or commands I have to execute to clear the cache in an image collection for an online app?  I've tried a OfflineOData.Clear action, but unsurprisingly that didn't do anything since I'm not using Offline functions.

Is there something I've missed in the ImageCollection control to clear the cache?  Ideally I'd like to code a rule on app launch to clear the cache, or check if it's older than a day then clear it.  I did about an hour of searching but I couldn't find any options.  Or do I need to implement Offline functionality like is done in the sample ImageHandlingApp?

This is an Android v14 app running the 24.11.2-001 client.

Appreciate your time, thank you!

entry.title: Re: CopyStep using Advanced Formula Step
entry.content:
@Joao_Costa 

You will need 2 parameters one to pass which year the script should run for and also the Actual cutoff period which in this case is 6.

TargetYear: Date dimension parameter. 

ActualPeriod: Period of last Actual, in your example 6

 

Something like below should work.

MEMBERSET [d/Date] = BASEMEMBER([d/Date].[h/YM], %TargetYear%)
INTEGER @ActPeriod
@ActPeriod = %ActualPeriod%

IF MONTH([d/Date]) <= @ActPeriod THEN
DATA() = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Actual")
ELSE
DATA() = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Version] = "public.Forecast")
ENDIF

 Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: U.S Tax Reporter Year End 2024
entry.content:
@graziela  @CarlosO @CarlosW @scar @CarlosAccorsi 

 

ALABAMA OVERTIME /PPE STOPS AT 06/30/2025.

 

Hi Team,

WE have Alabama overtime tax free till 6/30/2025… till this date system does make the overtime cumulated into /PPE wage type nontaxable. (system does this by cumulating overtime into /PPE wage types, amount is /PPE reduces the taxable base of /701 for Alabama).

After 06/30/2025 (Check date) system stops taking the amount in Overtime wage type (/PPE) as Non taxable (The taxable base ie /701 AL don’t get reduced by amount in /PPE) BSI calculates taxes into it.

Upon running W2 for the full year , I still see the taxable portion of /PPE wage type is getting added to Box 14 of employee W2.

 

Example of this scenario is given below

 

PERNR: XXXXXX is taken for my testing purpose, this employee has /PPE cumulated from 01/01/2025 till 6/30/2025 as $2000.00 (The amount cumulated in /PPE is nontaxable).

Now when I run payroll for 7/1/2025 till 7/15/2025, employee has overtime worth $1000.00. for this period system does cumulate /PPE for $1000.00, BSI identify that this amount is taxable from 07/01/2025 and calculate taxes for $1000.00 overtime.

Now when I run W2 for this employee System cumulate /PPE for $2000.00 (01/012025 till 06/30/2025 WHICH IS NON-TAXABLE) + /PPE for $1000.00 (7/1/2025 till 7/15/2025 WHICH IS TAXABLE) and shows $3000.00 instead of $2000.00 in Box 14 of employee W2.

entry.title: Re: Automate the transfer of picklists from LMS to BizX i...
entry.content:
Hi @Korn1 

In the standard process, data flows from BizX to LMS through either the Employee Export File or an Integrations job, customized to meet your business needs. These jobs create a file and place it in the designated SFTP folder, where the LMS connector job then uses the file to update information as required.

For guidance on learning connectors, please visit the resources  'How to Use SAP SuccessFactors Learning Connectors | SAP Help Portal' and 'Data Import to SAP SuccessFactors Learning | SAP Help Portal'.

How and where exactly should it be specified what SF should take from LMS and where to put it?  For learning connectors, LMS processes files from the SFTP folder defined in the CONNECTORS System Properties, updating data according to connector mapping (Connector Data Mapping Example | SAP Help Portal).

It is also possible to transfer data through APIs. Please refer to the 'SAP SuccessFactors Learning Micro Services List'.

For comprehensive guidance on using and implementing these integrations, we recommend reaching out to a Business Partner. They can help navigate the complexities and ensure your business needs are met. The above information offers a basic starting point for understanding these integration processes.

BR,

entry.title: Re: How to view the Approval Details in the Manage Credit...
entry.content:
How to view the Approval Details in the Manage Credit Memo Requests – Version 2 App.

  1. Open the Manage Credit Memo Request App.
  2. Click On the Credit Memo Request Number, in this case 600000107
  3. A pop up will appear
  4. In the pop-up click on the number 600000107
  5. This will display the Credit Memo Request Factsheet.
  6. Click on the Approval Details Tab.
  7. The Approval Details can be seen.

entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are working with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and have a question regarding the default assignment of Bill of Material (BOM) components to operations when a production order is created.

When we create a production order, the system automatically assigns all BOM components to the first operation (e.g., 0010) in the production order's component overview.

We need the system to automatically default these components to a later operation (e.g., 0020), instead of always defaulting to the initial operation.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: How to troubleshoot BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform Login issues
entry.content:
For those who are managing BusinessObjects Business Intelligence Platform(BIP) as an Administrator, this article will provide some guidance for how to troubleshoot some common user login issues.

In this blog many solutions and suggestions are provided based on different scenarios and error. This blog has many windows operating system related troubleshooting. However most of the suggestions/solutions are applicable to the Linux operating system also.

Way to narrow down the issue:

  • Verify whether you are accessing the login page for BI Launchpad or CMC. If you encounter an HTTP 500 or HTTP 404 error, you can refer to the additional suggestions provided in the blog below.
  • If you are unable to access the login page, you should verify whether your web application server (e.g., Tomcat) is running or has stopped. You can do this by navigating to your BI server and checking the Task Manager under the Details section to see if the tomcat9.exe process is active and consuming an adequate amount of memory. Additionally, assess whether the Tomcat process is stable or experiencing crashes.
  • For tomcat memory related issue you can try increasing Tomcat Max memory pool using KBA 2405536
  • For most of the tomcat related errors you can review Tomcat logs. (For Windows Stderr.log and stdout.log & for Linux Catalina. Out, catalina.date.log, localhost.date.log)
    • You can collect and analyze tomcat logs using the SAP KBA 3380026
    • Best Practice: How to identify or troubleshoot Tomcat crash, unresponsive or hanging issue, refer KBA 2075671

General troubleshooting and issue analysis:

  • If only certain users or specific individuals are encountering errors on the login page, you can attempt to log in using the default administrator account or an user from the Administrators user group to determine if the issue is related to security rights. In such cases, you may see an error message stating, "You do not have permission to log on to the application." To resolve this, please refer SAP KBA 2627502
  • In various situations, it is advisable to verify whether the cms.exe process is running and ensure that it is not experiencing crashes. You can check this from the Task Manager on the BI server.
  • You can verify whether you can log in to 'Manage Servers' in the Central Configuration Manager. This step will help clarify if the issue is related to the CMS connecting to the database or if there is a problem with the BOE web application, such as a configuration issue, corrupted web app cache etc.
    • If you are testing the above steps with Administrator user, you should be able to see the server status, indicating whether the servers are running, stopped, or in another state.
    • If you are testing with a non-admin user, you should be able to log in without encountering any errors; however, a blank screen may appear. 
  • If there are no issues related to the CMS or Tomcat processes, then as a basic troubleshooting step, you can try clearing the Tomcat cache by following the instructions provided in the KBA 1879431 
  • If the license key is not present, users other than administrator users/administrator group users may encounter an error related to the license key or receive a message indicating that their account information is not recognized.
  • Ensure that the database is running, available, and accepting connections from the Central Management Server (CMS). 
  • Increase the number of database connections from CMC.
  • Make sure that the BI / BOE Server can access the CMS database successfully.
  • Make sure that there are no network issues between the BI / BOE Server and the CMS database. There could be communication issues between the Central Management Server (CMS) database and the Business Intelligence (BI) server. As an initial troubleshooting step, you can restart both the database server and the BI server. 

Scenario 1: With Enterprise alias users are getting Account Information Not Recognized: Enterprise authentication could not log you on. Please make sure your logon information is correct. (FWB 00008)" error.

  1. This error can be observed if the user account is disabled. You can check the account status from the Central Management Console (CMC) by navigating to Users and Groups. Here, you can verify the user's account status either from the user account status overview or by checking the user's properties section. If the account is disabled, you will need to enable it to resolve the authentication issue.
    • If you are encountering an error with the Default Administrator account and it is disabled, you can use any user that belongs to the Administrators group to log in to the Central Management Console (CMC). Once logged in, you can re-enable the Default Administrator account.
    • If there are no users in the Administrators group available to log in, you can follow SAP KBA 1683657
  2. Check if you are able to log in using the Direct Tomcat URL. If you can log in successfully through this URL but encounter issues with the Load Balancer URL, you may need to involve the load balancer team to investigate potential configuration or connectivity issues. Additionally,  you can refer to SAP KBA 2805990 on  Investigating Load Balancer issues in BI 4.x
  3. Keeping an incorrect authentication type set as default when attempting to log in may result in errors. If you are unsure about the authentication type your users are using (such as Enterprise or Windows AD), you can enable the Authentication Type drop-down in the login interface by following SAP KBA 2485973
  4. From BI 4.3 SP3 P100 + and 4.3 SP4 +  it's mandatory for allowed.cms to be configured with the values that are desired to be used for the system field when logging in to web applications due to security fix.
    • Configure allowed.cms parameter & enter all cms entries in the below location for BILP / CMC:
      • INSTALLDIR\SAP BusinessObjects Enterprise XI 4.0\warfiles\webapps\BOE\WEB-INF\config\custom\global.properties
    • For detailed information refer SAP KBA 3414919

Scenario 2: (with third party authentication) getting HTTP errors or  Account Information Not Recognized

HTTP 500 and HTTP 404 errors can arise from various issues when using third-party SSO solutions like Windows AD or SAML. Common causes include misconfigurations.

  1. You can check if you are able to access the login page by bypassing the Single Sign-On (SSO) by appending /logonNoSso.jsp to the end of your BI Launchpad or Central Management Console (CMC) URL. For example: Eg. https://abc.xyz:8443/BOE/CMC/logonNoSso.jsp This step helps to verify if there are any issues with the SSO configuration. If you can access the login page using this method, it indicates that the SSO configuration may be the source of the problem. If you encounter issues even with this URL, the problem may lie elsewhere in the system.
  2. After workflows like Upgrade, Repair, deploy login with third party Authentication stops working throws error. For this refer SAP KBA 3525818
  3. There are several new configurations for SAML introduced after BI 4.3 SP4 P10+, as detailed in SAP KBA 2791348 - How To: Configure Front-End SAML Authentication on BI 4.3 / 2025
  4. New Trusted Authentication method is introduced in BI 4.3 SP4 P10 + and old trusted authentication method may not work after upgrade to BI 4.3 SP4 P10 + if users does not have enterprise alias. For more details check SAP Note 3578093 - Trusted Authentication not working for non-enterprise users in BI 4.3 SP4 Patch 10+ & BI 2025
  5. Front-End SAML SSO to BI intermittently fails with HTTP 500 Session Expired error. Refer SAP KBA 2672379

Scenario 3:  (FWM 20030) Could not reach CMS 'hostname:6400'

There are several possible causes for the error mentioned above, including:

  • The Central Management Server (CMS) is not started on the server machine
  • The hostname or name server port (default 6400) entered in the 'System' field is not resolvable
  • The hostname or request port (default auto-assign) of the CMS which is returned by the CMS name server is not resolvable or accessible from the client machine
  • CORBA SSL has been configured on one side of the communication, but not the other. eg:
    • CORBA SSL Configured on Tomcat, but not on the Server Intelligence Agent (SIA)
    • CORBA SSL configured on the SIA, but not on Tomcat

To resolve this issue you can try below:

  1. Make sure that CMS server port (default:6400) and CMS request port are open.
  2. Check using ping or telnet command if for communication issues
  3. Verify whether the hostname resolution for the BI server is functioning correctly. If it is not, you can add entries for the BI server in C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts
    • Add a new row to the end with the IP address, the server name, and the fully qualified domain name like:
      • 10.100.100.100 servername servername.FQDN
      • Also make sure from the client that the ping <HOSTNAME> returns the same IP address that was listed in the IP address field in the CMS metrics.
  4. To verify if the request ports assigned in the Central Management Console (CMC) > Servers are communicating properly with the BI server, you can use the Communication Analyzer by using SAP KBA 2393817 
  5. If you suspect that the issue may be related to CORBA SSL, you can check by disabling CORBA SSL and testing using SAP KBA 1920033 

Scenario 4: HTTP 500 and HTTP 404 error.

  1. Http Status 500-Internal Server Error on Fiori based BI Launchpad (/BOE/BI) while accessing via https only
    • After applying SAP BI 4.3 SP03 Patch 12, or 4.3 SP04 Patch 800 or BI 2025 patch 0 BI Launchpad is throwing error logging using https url. For the above you can refer SAP KBA 3495732 
  2. After installing or upgrading to BI 4.3 SP02 or above, and deploying the web applications ( BOE, biprws ) to non-bundled application servers like SAP Netweaver Java As, Weblogic, Websphere, JBoss or non-bundled Tomcat, you may receive -  
    • CMC or BI Launchpad fail with message Http Status 500-Internal Server Error or Internal Server Error
    • This could be due to missing SAPJCE libraries.
    • For the above you can refer SAP KBA 3153615
  3. HTTP 500 Internal Server Error accessing BI launchpad / CMC after upgrade to BI 2025. Refer SAP KBA 3586047

entry.title: Re: Default Component Operation Assignment in Production...
entry.content:
Hi,

In standard SAP, the assignment of BOM components to operations in a production order is primarily controlled by the Bill of Material (BOM) and the Routing (or Master Recipe).

By default, if a component in the Bill of Material (BOM) is not explicitly assigned to a specific operation, the system will automatically assign it to the first operation (usually 0010) of the routing when the production order is created. This is the behavior you are currently observing.

To achieve your desired behavior, you need to explicitly assign the components to the correct operation (e.g., 0020) within the Routing (or Master Recipe).

  1. Open the relevant Routing (or Master Recipe) for your finished product.
  2. Navigate to the Component Assignment section.
  3. For each component, you can specify the Operation Number to which it is consumed.
  4. Change the assignment from 0010 to 0020 (or your desired last operation).
  5. Save the Routing.

For additional details, please check the following SAP Help Page:

  • Component Assignment to Operations/Phases

Thanks and regards.

entry.title: Re: SAP Marketing Cloud Campaign Approval Workflow - Add...
entry.content:
Dear Rebeca,

Creating custom conditions for workflow consists of two major steps: Condition Definition and Condition Evaluation. This will be done in the Custom Logic app.

For your specific question, we will create a custom condition for the Program name.

  1. Condition Definition
CONSTANTS custom_condition_id TYPE string VALUE 'PROGRAM_NAME'.

    " Define a condition to evaluate the name of the program
    ct_condition = VALUE #( ( id       = custom_condition_id
                              subject  = 'Program name'
                              type     = if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_def=>cs_condtype-start_step ) ).

    " The condition should be evaluated as 'true'  (Program name is equal to)
    "                                   or 'false' (Program name is not equal to)
    ct_parameter = VALUE #( ( id        = custom_condition_id
                              xsd_type  = if_swf_flex_ifs_condition_def=>cs_xstype-string ) ).
  • Condition Evaluation
CONSTANTS custom_condition_id TYPE string VALUE 'PROGRAM_NAME'.

    cv_is_true = abap_false.

    IF is_condition-condition_id <> custom_condition_id.
      RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE cx_ble_runtime_error.
    ENDIF.

    READ TABLE it_parameter_value INTO DATA(param_value) INDEX 1.

    SELECT SINGLE MarketingProgram INTO @DATA(program_guid)
      FROM i_mkt_initiative
      WHERE campaignid = @IS_sap_object_node_type-sont_key_part_1.

    SELECT SINGLE MarketingProgramName INTO @DATA(program_name)
        FROM I_MKT_Program
        WHERE MarketingProgram = @Program_guid.

    cv_is_true = xsdbool( TO_UPPER( param_value-value ) = TO_UPPER( program_name ) ).

After publishing the custom logic, your new Program Name condition should work.

Feel free to ask more questions if needed.

Best Regards,

Mackenzie

entry.title: Unlocking Efficiency with Signavio in SAP Fieldglass
entry.content:
Are you ready to get a whole new perspective on your daily operations?  SAP Fieldglass Business Process diagrams can now be imported to Signavio, offering a powerful new alternative to visualize, document, and optimize your company’s workflows. 

Signavio is an extensive suite of process management tools, designed to enhance business efficiency. The Process Manager offers a familiar diagramming interface with robust capabilities. The Collaboration Hub facilitates the viewing and commenting on existing process diagrams, without the need to modify them. Process Governance provides change management controls by enabling modification approval prior to diagram publishing. And the Process Intelligence mines process metadata, presenting it in a more visualized form, aligned with the process flow within Signavio. 

 

Key Benefits of Signavio 

Here’s why Signavio is a game-changer: 

  • Easy Process Design: Signavio lets you see, document, and optimize business processes, making implementation faster and more efficient. 
  • Standardization: It helps standardize processes across the organization, following the best practices. 
  • Collaboration: The platform fosters collaboration by providing a centralized tool for all stakeholders to align on process designs and decisions. 
  • Compliance and Governance: Signavio processes adhere to organizational policies and regulatory requirements. 
  • Flexibility and Adaptability: It lets you make quick adjustments to processes, enabling a faster response to changes or challenges during implementation. 
  • Accelerated Decision-Making: By providing data-driven insights, Signavio supports better and quicker decision-making during the implementation phase. 
  • Improved User Adoption: Clear and well-documented processes make it easier for new users to get started and feel comfortable. 

 

Integrating with SAP Cloud ALM 

Get to know what it takes to run Signavio: 

In the SAP Cloud ALM you can create a project and define its scope as SAP Fieldglass Vendor Management System to have instant access to SAP Fieldglass business process diagrams. This let’s you customize standard workflows to best suit your business needs. 

To connect your SAP Signavio tenant to SAP Cloud ALM for process synchronization, first go through both of the following SAP Help Portal articles: 

  • See SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation to learn how to connect the tenants and Synchronizing BPMN Diagrams to SAP Cloud ALM to learn how to synchronize diagrams from SAP Signavio to SAP Cloud ALM.

With that complete, follow these steps to create a project: 

  1. Access your SAP Cloud ALM account 
  2. Select Implementation 
  3. Select Projects and Setup 
  4. Select Create 
  5. Enter a Name in the Project field 
  6. Select SAP Fieldglass – Implementation in the SAP Activate Roadmap field 
  7. Select Save 

Now, you must assign SAP Fieldglass Vendor Management System scope to your project: 

  1. Select the Scopes tab in your created project 
  2. Select Manage Scopes 
  3. Select Create and Scope 
  4. Define a name in the Scope field 
  5. In the Solution Scenarios section search for SAP Fieldglass Vendor Management System and enable it 
  6. Select Save 

Lastly, you must add the SAP Fieldglass solution processes that are part of your deployment (Services, Contingent and/or Profile Worker): 

  1. Select Process Scoping 
  2. Select Edit Scope 
  3. Enable the processes you want to add by toggling them on 
  4. Select End Scoping 

  Click the image for a short video of the steps

 

Importing SAP Fieldglass Process Diagrams to Signavio 

To import SAP Fieldglass Business Process to your Signavio instance: 

  1. Access the SAP Signavio Process Navigator page 
  2. Select Solution Scenarios 
  3. Select SAP Fieldglass Vendor Management System 
  4. Select a Solution Process

Each solution process has multiple diagrams, which represent the different workflows for that SAP Fieldglass module. 

To open a diagram: 

  1. Select the Solution Process Flow tab 
  2. Select the drop-down menu next to the current diagram displayed 

To download the diagram: 

  1. Select the Download button 
  2. Choose BPMN 

Now you must upload the diagram to your Signavio Process Modeler account: 

  1. Access SAP Signavio Process Modeler 
  2. Select Import / Export 
  3. Select Import BPMN 2.0 XML 
  4. Select Choose File 
  5. Choose the diagram downloaded from SAP Signavio Process Navigator 
  6. Select Import

Now you can open and edit the diagram in Signavio, and customize it to fit your business requirements. 

Click the image for a short video of the steps

 

More Details 

For more insights into Signavio’s functionalities, visit SAP Signavio Help Portal page, and to know more about process flows, you can review the SAP Signavio Process Manager Help Portal page. 

For any questions related to the product, we invite you to use the comments section below.
